Reviews.Author: Xiaodong Cheng
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful unit, with solid construction, gorgeous display, and of course very light and thin compared with older models. It is running very smoothly  when running games. The battery life is really impressive considering its size. After 5 hours of non stopping video streaming, the battery dropped from 100% to 60%! I am very happy with my purchase and have nothing to complain!
Reviews.Title: Very happy with the purchase

Reviews.Author: Bobby Anderson
Reviews.Content: Love it overall.  Amazing product.  I have an ipad 4 and this in my house now.  The size and weight of this is terrific, though the comments about the brightness being less and the screen feeling a little cheaper rang true to me as well.I am also having the memory loss issue on the ipad air some have mentioned.  First, there is an ipad 4 in my household and it is also 16gb and, having passed it down to a family member, was very happy with it.  That said, the 16gb Ipad 4 has about 13.5 gb of usable space prior to loading anything, while the air somehow has 12.8.  Not really a big deal.  However, I have noticed my usable memory dropping dramatically (500 mb) on the air when doing streaming or using facetime.  I don't recall that happening on the ipad 4.  The memory does not recover afterwards, even after days and seems to continue to drop 100mb every other day even when I'm not using it.  It is not the apps or newspapers loading, as I pulled a lot of stuff off to check it.  I'm a light user of apps and don't store content, so 16gb was enough in my prior ipads, but on this one I'm getting worried. I was able to free the memory back up, but only after doing a full restore of the ipad as new and letting my cloud stuff stream back.  I really don't want to have to do full restores every few months.  For those interested, when connecting to itunes, it is the "other" category of memory that keeps expanding.  Tried calling Apple several times, but all they could offer was to do the restore.
Reviews.Title: Nice, but some issues.

Reviews.Author: RUSH46
Reviews.Content: Bought this specifically to download and use some speech therapy applications for my wife who had a stroke.  The delivery was timely.  The applications are loaded and have been very useful.  All the other things we can do are a bonus.  We use the games after therapy in the morning.  And we can even check our e-mail.  We are getting along in age and were hesitant to spend the money on something so modern, but it really is not that difficult to use after a few days.
Reviews.Title: Why did I wait so long

Reviews.Author: Sean Cushman
Reviews.Content: Alright so I know if you are reading this then you already have your mind set on a new iPad and hey you know what? That's great. I'm a dual user. I love my PC products and Android and I love my mobile Apple products as well. I don't take sides or at least only when it concerns the best bang for the money at least. I've been using iPad's since I bought my mother her first one at release (she is disabled and iPad's (or tablets in general) are wonderful tools for those less than capable of using a keyboard and mouse. I also fell in love with it , the design was just amazing , the feel was great and the capability was very impressive when you consider at that time tablet's were barely around at the consumer level. Seeing the look on her face made it worth every single penny. Prior to getting the iPad she suffered a horrible infection and was hospitalized for 4 months fighting it , nearly losing her life in the process. She lost the capability to stand and only has use of her left hand now (with about 80 percent capability) and couple that with MS and you get someone who can't really use a mouse and keyboard setup easily.I wanted to state that before what I'm sure I will be accused of being a critical troll about the latest iPad version compared to a recent Android tablet I bought.Now onto the experience thus far with this new iPad , here is a list of what I like :1. LIGHT. Seriously , incredibly light. I can hold it in one hand very comfortably and its not meant to be held in such a way for the regular Joe ( I got big hamhocks for hands). I love it when technology trims up as it shows that its forward march is continuing without pause.2. FAST. Even over the iPad 4th generation this lean machine is even faster at multitasking which is good because it will help versus the recent Android tablet I bought which is a multitasking god.3. THIN BEZEL. If there is one complaint I have for the consumer electronics of the world in general its that we haven't done enough to remove overly large bezels from products. I hate them. I find they are a waste of real estate but I also realize that this is part of the technical limitation and the need for space for various reasons (board hardware , batteries and so on). The iPad Air's bezel is at least half of all previous iPad's. Very much appreciated Apple.Those are the biggest reasons to buy an iPad Air and they are really good ones in my mind. If you already own an iPad 4th gen though I don't think they are enough to justify the upgrade unless you really want the reduced weight (the iPad 4th gen is a pound and half while the iPad Air is only a pound flat).Now to the cons. And there are some that are very concerning and especially so if you tend to treat your products poorly (many people do..) :1. THIN PIECE OF GLASS. So while I realize that Gorilla Glass 3 is very impressive and amazing tough for its extremely thin profile .. I also feel its wildly out of place with a product like the iPad. People who buy iPad's and especially families tend to treat them pretty rough. I've seen children as young as 4 drop a 3rd gen iPad like a brick onto hardwood and it remained intact without a mark to bare. This new iPad Air has a very thin piece of GG3 that helps reduce the weight (and I would imagine the cost of manufacturing for Apple) but its recently been shown in several Youtube videos that when it comes to endurance its actually pretty fragile. Its very easy to crack it and especially so if it lands on its side. So while all the previous generation iPad's had a nice thick piece of glass to help protect the product this new one .. does not. It also sounds hollow when you tap it. And for some that drives them crazy. I don't mind this as I know its glass and not plastic like some "claim".2.COST. Since Apple did so much to slim down the cost of this new iPad and they used the EXACT same guts as the iPhone 5 (with a different layout and power profile) and yet they also trimmed down the battery size then how come this isn't any cheaper? The iPad mini is supposedly Apple's response to critics about the fact that its always the same price in each iteration. Apple , Android has fantastic alternatives now and the Google Play marketplace is becoming quite a fleshed out competitor , its time to start taking Android more seriously as a competitor and stop living inside your own eco bubble.3.SUB PAR HARDWARE VERSUS PRICE. Even with a new 64-bit chip (which isn't supported very well but that will change) the iPad is quite a puny product in terms of hardware specs. NOW BEFORE YOU FREAK OUT.. I know that Apple has optimized it heavily and that living in a very closed ecosystem (versus Android) gives it this advantage HOWEVER.. for what you are paying for you should be getting more. 1GB of RAM for instance? That's what I expect in a mid to low end smartphone these days. I can imagine those who complain (and have for a while now) about the random crashes because of running of memory would really love an extra 1GB of RAM for the iPad. I would also imagine it would do wonders for those who love to open programs by the truckload and not have to worry about random crashing errors due to running out of memory.Could you imagine a quad core A7 chip with 2 GB's of RAM? That beast would sing and you could do even more with an iPad that powerful. I would bet that when Apple moves towards 4k resolution that we will be getting those exact specs to run at that monster resolution but still I would have loved that right now.So my remarks about a recent Android tablet purchase.. I bought a Samsung Galaxy Note Pro 12.2 and I just have to say its a real beast and outshines Apple's best in many ways. The resolution is higher (2500x1600) and it comes with the S-Pen and S-Pen software plus an office suite of apps. Now the Note Pro 12.2 is made for business applications the price of it versus 64GB iPad is about a hundred more. But for that hundred more you get massive hardware support , with an OTG USB cable you can connect external hard drives to it , you can also add memory through SDXC cards (up to 128GB's) and Samsung's Touch Wiz is getting quite mature and really offers a very set of apps. Not to mention the screen size of 12.2 inches versus 9.7. However the iPad beats it in terms of weight , the Galaxy Note Pro 12.2 has a massive battery (but it lasts about 11 hours with heavy use) and the weight puts it into a class that speaks more towards laptop replacement that competitor to the iPad. However you can buy the non-pro versus for $100 less (you won't get the S-Pen) and still a get a monster solution.Android's tablet app market is getting better and better each week and there are plenty of apps that support landscape mode without issue. One thing I always thought Android did better was application scaling , something Apple could learn from frankly. The Galaxy Note 3 Pro in my mind is a Android finally getting its ducks in a row and Apple is going to have pick the pace to keep with Android's MASSIVE market share which is over double what Apple's is now.THAT BEING SAID.. I'm keeping the iPad Air. I love the Galaxy Note Pro 12.2 and its just a great tablet but I don't really have need of its business level features. But if I were going to recommend a tablet for a business minded individual I would recommend they go for it because it blows the iPad away for business use. The free office app it comes with is more fleshed out than MS Office for the iPad and the extra screen real estate is a big bonus for anyone attempting real work on it. But for a guy like me the iPad has an easier to consume profile and that's what I really love about it.If you intend to buy this product however (the iPad Air) I HIGHLY recommend you buy the Apple care warranty. You will be extremely glad you did with this powerful but more fragile new version of the iPad.
Reviews.Title: The best tablet on the market when you consider the ecosystem and support. But not without some downfalls due to recent changes.

Reviews.Author: Marc Kennedy
Reviews.Content: I'm a grad student and when my laptop went on the fritz, this was my replacement.Pros - The Apple App Store is easier to navigate and more trustworthy in my opinion than the Android app store.- like my iPhone, the interface is clean and much less cluttered than my Samsung tablet- the onscreen keyboard is very useable- there are a lot of available accessories, as should be expected- this seemed like less of a toy to me than a Kindle Fire- free iWork apps- so lightweight- great battery life- the screen is beautiful- I can download all my docs from DropboxCons- the external button to put it to sleep is small- it may just be the screen protector I purchased (Tech Armor clear), but the distance between the home button and the edge of the bezel is small and the screen protector will not seal there- no fingerprint scanner like the iPhone 5s- there is currently not a flawless PDF app for iPad, so using Adobe reader on my laptop was a better experience
Reviews.Title: As a Laptop Replacement, No Real Downsides So Far

Reviews.Author: Sallyann Wagoner
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this!!  I use it to replace my computer when I am just doing web searches and reading magazines.  I love all the apps it has available and I have even gotten my husband to use it too.  This replaces my original Ipad which I received for Valentine's day the first year the Ipad came out.  It still works great, but is slow and has no camera.  Buy this now!!!Sallyann
Reviews.Title: Ipad Air

Reviews.Author: Tiffney Brink
Reviews.Content: It was brand new right out of the factory package. It has an amazing battery life and a beautiful display.
Reviews.Title: Fantastic iPad air

Reviews.Author: Herb Lippe "Indi"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my iPad Generation 1.  Much faster, clearer, LIGHTER, and more powerful.I think I made one mistake that has caused a minor problem with Safari. Instead of setting everything up from scratch, I downloaded everything from my the Cloud Storage for my iPhone 5S. The problem is I can get TABS in Safari.  I bypassed this by using the Mercury Browser and, as soon as the Christmas panic dies down, I'll bring it in to an Apple store and see what I did wrong.Definitely worth the upgrade.
Reviews.Title: Much better than my iPad 1.

Reviews.Author: S. Harrison "LovePinkCJ"
Reviews.Content: I've been true to Apple for many years but recently took the plunge and went to Samsung for my smartphone.  I almost got the Samsung tablet but just couldn't bring myself to it.  If you love Apple...  you'll love the newer, leaner, and cleaner design and OS. If you're technologically advanced...  I'm sure you'll find the flaws but you'll still enjoy the iPad Air.
Reviews.Title: Lives up to the hype

Reviews.Author: Helena R McMaster
Reviews.Content: This is my first iPad.  So I can't compare to any of the others.  It looks great feels great, and most importantly it works great and once you get the easy setup process done it operates great and very easy to use.  I did feel the need to purchase a case because it is very thin and light weight.  I purchased the survivor case.  Great for this case, makes the weight heavier but protects if dropped.
Reviews.Title: Awesome

Reviews.Author: R. Lee "Gadget lover"
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth iPad and it is by far the iPad out there.  I love the light weight, faster connection, quicker processing time, and less charging time (with the 12W charger).  I use it every day and I love it.If you are in the market for an iPad, check it out.  Apple's support, generous return policy, durability, ease of use, consistency in OS, abundant apps, and high quality are the strong points.  My first iPad from 3 years ago is still working flawlessly today and yes, it is also being used daily by my family members.
Reviews.Title: Best iPad so far!

Reviews.Author: Yong Yang
Reviews.Content: Received an used item, all accessories were loosely re-packed,  and not sure if everything is there. The box has two 2-4 inch cuts.
Reviews.Title: The Item was not as described. It was a used item re-packed.

Reviews.Author: mavpcc
Reviews.Content: I bought this product and really love it! Only one thing wrong, the USB cable does not work and I have been unable to recharge the unit. Fortunate for me, my wife has an I-Phone 5 and the cords are compatible. I travel a lot, so I really need my own charger but more importantly, I need the one that I paid for to work properly....
Reviews.Title: Love the product but wont recharge!

Reviews.Author: jean
Reviews.Content: I got the iPad because my daughters had one and I am now hooked! It is so convenient to take on trips and can do almost everything I can do on my laptop while out of town. The slim size is great too for keeping weight down in my carry on. Couldn't be happier!
Reviews.Title: My first iPad, I love it!

Reviews.Author: Guo Ming Wang
Reviews.Content: This is a great product. I got the space gray 32gb one. It's light,fast,and convenient. However it looks like t's easy to break but besides that this is an awesome machine
Reviews.Title: FAST LIGHT N CONVENIENT

Reviews.Author: Dawn Clark
Reviews.Content: I recommend this Ipad to all who were just like me.  I had the very first Ipad.  Oh my gosh, what a difference!  As I lay them side to side I cannot believe I held onto my old one for so long!  The new features and pictures and sound are more enriched for eyes and ears to enjoy!  It is so light and thin!  I have not been more happy with any item in past two years as I am with this Ipad!  It is more than worth the price!  It only needs a USB port and it would be perfect!
Reviews.Title: Fantastic Ipad

Reviews.Author: Margie
Reviews.Content: The individual I presented this to as a gift told me this Apple iPad Air MD786LL/A is AWESOME!  It does everything Apple claims it to do and does it extremely well.  The floor is beautiful and sharp, the apps are great and the entire package is packed with useable and the best you can get for your money.Yes, I would definitely recommend this product.  It is a Class A Act!
Reviews.Title: GREAT GIFT...LIVED UP TO ALL EXPECTATIONS...

Reviews.Author: rlasrado
Reviews.Content: Cheaper to procure from Amazon than an Apple store. Perfect.Tons of reviews on the ipad [my second air]- number of apple products in the household so a no brainer. Yes it has it's issues - cannot multitask, no usb etc but those are sacrifices for the overall experience
Reviews.Title: Cheaper than an Apple store

Reviews.Author: Katerina Nares
Reviews.Content: This iPad is incredible slim, user friendly, useful, fast.  I cannot believe my finger could control everything on it.  What an invention!  Bravo Mac
Reviews.Title: Incredible

Reviews.Author: Thikacat
Reviews.Content: Amazingly versatile and much lighter than the older models.  I use it several times a day and it is a read time saver.
Reviews.Title: Upgraded from an iPad 2 -- very happy!

Reviews.Author: sgun73 "Steve"
Reviews.Content: I've had every generation of ipad and both minis and several androids and this tablet right here and now is the best ever made and my clear favorite. The thinness and lightness almost doesn't make sense. I did find myself confused at first as to how such an amazing device could be made by humans. Maybe it wasn't. Could have come from space. Or maybe the Enterprise from the future brought it back to Apple and said here. Enjoy.But seriously, the build quality is wonderful. As light and thin as this tablet is it still feels solid and sturdy. The screen is beautiful and the colors are deep and rich. The colors are actually noticeably better than the first and second generation minis. I've held them side by side and there is a pretty wide gap between the two in terms of richness of color. The ipad air looks vibrant and robust with deep blacks and warm bold colors.Plus it's very fast. I loaded up GT Racing 2 last night and it ran flawlessly fast and looked absolutely gorgeous. I couldn't believe how sharp the cars looked and the backgrounds had such depth. I should stop writing and go play right now.Despite the other great tablets like the Nexus 7 and 10 or the Samsung Galaxies 8 and 10 the ipad air is in another realm. A realm all to itself. You'll never pick up another tablet and be shocked at the miracle of design you hold in your hands.
Reviews.Title: Crazy thin and light plus beautiful screen

Reviews.Author: DRM
Reviews.Content: Great tablet and I have been slow to get on the Apple wagon.  Many apps even in my narrow field make this a better tablet for now than the alternatives.
Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Author: wunat
Reviews.Content: Great product! Fast delivery. I use it pretty much for everything. Very good tablet. Fast light and powerful. Battery life is great.
Reviews.Title: Great product! Fast light and powerful

Reviews.Author: m y carr
Reviews.Content: The light weight is great.The wide screen I love.The clear and sharp viewing is beautiful .The fast speed you just can't beat.
Reviews.Title: Home run !

Reviews.Author: aldridge
Reviews.Content: Everything is a la carte, so it becomes a drag to go to the Apple store and then discover it does not have as many apps as Android.You have to compartmentalize different programs and that slows down the interaction between the user and the technology. It is more secure, but it has a longer learning curve. Without Flash it limits where to go. Had 2, sold one and may want to sell the other Air to buy something more accessible. when it is side by side with other non-Apple tablets, it is an expensive16 gig, non-upgrading, email item.
Reviews.Title: Not all that

Reviews.Author: Vertigo
Reviews.Content: Nice tablet with a fatally flawed web browser problem.  My iPad Air started with Safari crashing right out of the box.  I put up with it for a month and then had it replaced by Apple under warranty, however, the problem continued.  The experts at the Genius Bar said the problem would be fixed in iOS 7.1.  After upgrading to 7.1 today the issue persists.  Puffin browser seems more stable but still crashes on occasion.  Apple's failure to fix this is unacceptable.
Reviews.Title: Buyer beware

Reviews.Author: grittynitty
Reviews.Content: Finally got a good chunk of cash when my tax return came and decided to get my own iPad (family had an iPad 2 but surely couldn't call it my own). I couldn't be happier. This thing is so well made and noticeably lighter and sturdier than the iPad 2. Very easy to set up as well.I recommend spending a little extra to get more memory. App sizes are just going to get bigger as time goes on. It just didn't make sense to me to pay so much for only 16 GB; I got the 64 GB myself and feel this iPad should serve me well for at least the next three years.
Reviews.Title: Absolutely stunning

Reviews.Author: Charlie W.
Reviews.Content: he iPad Air is a LOT lighter than the iPad 4, much faster (mostly play games on mine) and is solidly built. It's just expensive. All the games that had framerate issues on the 4 play smooth as silk now. Sound has improved as well. Also, the camera has improved. I took some really great photos of a storm that passed through, as well as some video.
Reviews.Title: iPad Air..works great, fast, but expensive!

Reviews.Author: Linda Childs
Reviews.Content: What I don't understand is, I'm working for the U.S. Navy in Yokosuka, Japan.  You sent this iPad to me at our P.O. Box here.  However, when I went back to Amazon and tried to order a case for it, I received a message that said you could not send computers overseas.  Really?  I just wanted to buy the case and you had already sent the iPad.  Kind of strange don't you think?
Reviews.Title: Apple products are the best

Reviews.Author: JDub "AmazonPrime Directive"
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the product and the buying/shipping process. I bought this as a gift and the recipient loves the iPad!
Reviews.Title: Very happy customer!

Reviews.Author: Zach Zillig
Reviews.Content: Best ipad yet. I've had the ipad 2-4. The air is by far the fastest and best looking. Use it daily.
Reviews.Title: Best iPad yet

Reviews.Author: Jeet
Reviews.Content: Best tablet out there! Fast, light, excellent screen resolution and very good battery life. No contract from At&T; ! So if you need just take a plan and use.What else you need.I would strongly command.
Reviews.Title: Best tablet in Market

Reviews.Author: Luann McCarrell
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Apple iPad Air. .  Easy to use.  Great screen quality.  Photo quality is good too.
Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Author: Jay and Phyllis Silverman
Reviews.Content: This was a graduation gift for our granddaughter.  It arrived on time and in perfect shape.  We were very pleased and she was thrilled.
Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied

Reviews.Author: SWM "SWM"
Reviews.Content: Beautifully designed, solidly made, super fast processor & access to great apps. Simple setup, quick wi-fi access, and very easy to use (highly intuitive interface). Something interesting to share with those that need to make international calls- I installed the Viber app on the iPad even though it's made for the iPhone and it works! I can now make free international calls via Viber through this wi-fi only iPad- convenient & free. Anyway, I think this device makes life easier and more enjoyable- highly recommended.
Reviews.Title: Amazing device

Reviews.Author: Manuel Velasco "Maveco"
Reviews.Content: I got the iPad and begin to run videos from sites I could not make work on my previous android devises. Even though the iPad operating system is not as open as the android os, I like what I see so far. Very clear display and great apps to use. A very fast tablet.
Reviews.Title: Very good product

Reviews.Author: Jin Bolong
Reviews.Content: my friends told me to buy one for him, he really likes it.  why it require so so many words.
Reviews.Title: very good device

Reviews.Author: li Zhang
Reviews.Content: It's value for money. I bought it several months ago,and everything is ok. very good quality.I like it very much.
Reviews.Title: very good

Reviews.Author: CB
Reviews.Content: Love it,feels heaver then 1 lb with the otter box I put on it , so I can't hold it that long,but all in all best apple device I have ever owned.
Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Author: Liv Torkildsen
Reviews.Content: I am taking it with me to Europe, so she will set it up herself.  As far as I can hope it works fine
Reviews.Title: Gift for my daughter

Reviews.Author: ronald williams
Reviews.Content: This device meets the expectations of performance and easy functional use. As technology development continues, I see less and less nuecense of previous flaws
Reviews.Title: Apple iPad Air consistent to reputation

Reviews.Author: tomana
Reviews.Content: if you are a musician and want a device like this for sheet music on stage, then this is the one for you. Buy this and also the AirTurn pedals (get the 4 pedal if you can afford it), download the Free app called OnSong and you're on your way to sheet music turning goodness {8^D
Reviews.Title: it's Very nice, it's for musicians, it's Apple

Reviews.Author: David S. Thompson
Reviews.Content: Bought the iPad Air to use when traveling.  It is just what I need.  It weighs about 1.75 lbs. with the case and battery charger.  The screen is wonderfully sharp.  I does all the things I needs and more and it is fast.  I find that I use it often browse the web and check emails at home.  So far I am very happy with it and would recommend it.
Reviews.Title: Great Replacement for Laptop When Traveling

Reviews.Author: amr88
Reviews.Content: Over the last few years I have used a variety of tablets from the Samsung Galaxy, Samsung Note, Kindle, Nexus 10, Nexus 7, and now the iPad Air. The iPad is my favorite by far.Great screen resolution. The battery life on par or better than other tablets but really excels in stand by time.There are so many great applications made specifically for the iPad. The other tablets just don't come close to this.Some enjoy on screen buttons buttons on Android tablets but I find myself accidentally hitting one of the buttons. The iPad has gestures to easily navigate the device.The best on screen keyboard of any tablet. Far more accurate.Endless selection of accessories.We'll worth the money.
Reviews.Title: Best tablet hands down

Reviews.Author: mike teeple
Reviews.Content: I ordered for my 10 yr old grandson for his birthday. It came exactly as promised, both on time and what we ordered. Thanks
Reviews.Title: Ipad air

Reviews.Author: ALICE P. SMALLEY
Reviews.Content: I have another ipad and wanted a smaller one.  I find this one easier to travel with.  It fits in my large tote bag that I use for travel.
Reviews.Title: Love the smaller size

Reviews.Author: LadyLaTweet
Reviews.Content: All I can say is FANTABULOUS!!! I thought my Kindle Fire was great - this is even better-faster, more options, just love it!
Reviews.Title: Just as I expected!

Reviews.Author: Dave Calabro
Reviews.Content: So far it has been great. The only thing I struggle with is the back button doesn't always take you back one screen.
Reviews.Title: Great Product

Reviews.Author: MuEl
Reviews.Content: This tablet is extremely light from a very robust, and runs all my favorite games and apps really quickly. 128GB is exactly what I needed. The T-Mobile connection is awesome! Free 200MB FTW!
Reviews.Title: Amazing tablet, everything it does it does extremely well

Reviews.Author: Marigold
Reviews.Content: It has great clarity in the screen.  Like all MAC products its easy to use and leads you through setting it up.
Reviews.Title: Like this

Reviews.Author: Thelma A. Kennard
Reviews.Content: I really like it. It is very useful . I was going to get a laptop, but I don't need to now.
Reviews.Title: iPad airmd785ll/a

Reviews.Author: Ben Evenhuis
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the light weight yet solid feel of this Ipad. It is by far the best model yet. It is the top tablet out there on the market. If you are looking for one that does it all and is easy to use buy this Ipad.
Reviews.Title: Ipad air

Reviews.Author: Linda RDH
Reviews.Content: This is a great little, lightweight piece of technology to own.  It came on time. The only disappointment is that there are no obvious directions in the box to guide my set-up.  What can I say... I am old-school wanting written directions.  I am charging it now and will hopefully follow prompts after that!  Thank God for Google....
Reviews.Title: nice piece of technology

Reviews.Author: Walter Pinkham
Reviews.Content: Been working great easy to learn had just a little help from daughter, only complaint is apple just charges too much. Using apples face time neat talking with anyone who has facetime via the internet.
Reviews.Title: Apple still costing too much

Reviews.Author: Thomas B
Reviews.Content: I am glad I didn't upgrade until this version of the iPad.  It's a fantastic device.  It's fast and far more capable from the clunky original ipad.  It's battery life is baffling.  I literally plug it in at most once every two weeks.  It's around for quick web searches, some games and email.  I am sure I could drain the battery in a day, if I tried hard enough, but I'd probably lose my mind in the process.I own a lot of Android devices, as well.  They  don't deserved to be considered in the same breath.  Their engineering is all over the spectrum, but never reach the heights of Apple's flawless execution.  I attribute android's failure to it's architecture around Java and old school mentality of making a product that works, sells, but never excels.  There's literally no better alternative  than an apple device, and I am not a Steve Jobs fan.
Reviews.Title: Upgrading from the original ipad

Reviews.Author: mdgirl
Reviews.Content: The ipad air was a gift and person was delighted.  It is lighter and easier to handle. Makes an awesome gift.
Reviews.Title: Birthday Gift

Reviews.Author: Donald Furgeson Sr
Reviews.Content: Nice, very nice. I own a iPod and hate typing on it (fat fingers, small keyboard). One feature I love about this iPad air is the keyboard size.
Reviews.Title: Worth the price.

Reviews.Author: Mands "Chips and Gravy"
Reviews.Content: Took a long time for me to get an iPad ,at last I got this iPad Air and I love it. The product was delivered on time and and exactly as stated.
Reviews.Title: Love it !

Reviews.Author: Nida Elahi Khan
Reviews.Content: Love to use it for reading and work etc. The new processor definitely beats the iPad 4. everything loads faster and feels smoother. And its more portable.
Reviews.Title: Use it for  reading and love it.

Reviews.Author: Barbara Burchfield
Reviews.Content: This little baby rocks!  I had the first generation for five years and she was still going strong, but decided to update and treat myself!  I am so amazed with this little jewel.  Fast, clear and light.  I am still discovering all of the tricks, but I am in love all over again!
Reviews.Title: WOW!

Reviews.Author: wonno
Reviews.Content: Gift for my husband who loves it.  Wish I had one, too!  Easy to learn and use and easy to carry.  Graphics are incomparable. Does everything he wants to do and more.
Reviews.Title: He loved it.

Reviews.Author: Richa tripathi
Reviews.Content: Definitely an improvement in comparison to the previous versions of ipad. However, it is not as airy as is usually claimed.
Reviews.Title: iPad Air lighter and slicker

Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: There are many tablets out there that you could purchase instead of the iPad and save yourself money. For those of us who have to work off Apple systems - purchasing the iPad makes life easier rather then purchasing another brand tablet and having to download various apps to make everything compatible.Apple does make superior products so there's not complaints here for this tablet other than the price. I'm an Apple user and I'm very happy with the iPad air - every aspect of it.The one piece of advice I will give is if you don't need the iPad don't get it. If you work with Apple products and need a tablet then there's no reason you should complicate your work flow with a non-Apple product.
Reviews.Title: Superior tablet

Reviews.Author: Philip L Korenstra
Reviews.Content: Product is a good as everyone clams.  Delivery was received within 24 hours.  The air is a product for the future.
Reviews.Title: IPad Air

Reviews.Author: Carl Harmon
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a friend, as I had one myself. The person isn't near any Apple store, so I wanted to make sure I got them a good one, and with insurance (Square Trade) with it as well.  Was delivered to them in Two days, and they've been having fun with it ever since.
Reviews.Title: A wonderful gift / merchandise

Reviews.Author: L. Gabriel "the frugal cook"
Reviews.Content: After using my old early version of iPad for years I am enjoying the speed, easier downloads, and excellent graphics.
Reviews.Title: I love it!

Reviews.Author: Julio A. Pieraldi
Reviews.Content: A gift for my wife. She's happy, I'm a hero in her eyes. Now I'm questioning her if I should get one for myself.
Reviews.Title: A birthday gift.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl Faulkner
Reviews.Content: I've been an Apple fan for years, so once again I wasn't disappointed -- wonderful product, easy to set up and use, lightweight -- overall a fun device!
Reviews.Title: Love my new ipad!

Reviews.Author: lana mccloud
Reviews.Content: I love the size, it is so lightweight and easy to work with.  It is  well worth the price. I would highly recommend this item!
Reviews.Title: Great item!

Reviews.Author: Spazpilot
Reviews.Content: I've waited a long time to get one of these believing that it would never replace MacBook Pro, but it just about has. I now use it for iChat, Facetime, Netflix, eBay, Amazon, RiteAid... just about everything. The only thing missing (and only really important to my wife) would be OfficeMac so she could use excel, et. for work when we are away from home.
Reviews.Title: Very First iPad

Reviews.Author: J. White
Reviews.Content: Amazon has done a very poor job on marketing the HDX 8.9. Don't waste your time or money on it. Buy the Apple Air Ipad. The HDX may be cheaper but it is not worth the sacrifice. The Ipad is great.
Reviews.Title: Better buy than the Kindle HDX

Reviews.Author: Scott F Latham
Reviews.Content: Previously had an  iPad2 which I loved but gave tomy son whose laptop died.  The iPad Air is the best of tablets.
Reviews.Title: Best tablet among the competition !

Reviews.Author: calvin
Reviews.Content: Great replacement for my IPad 2 great picture quality and real light to hold. Can't wait tosee the next generation of  I Pad's
Reviews.Title: Apple I Pad Air

Reviews.Author: Geraldine S.
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my daughter.  She loves it and it's in use all day every day.  Can't beat an Apple product.
Reviews.Title: Great

Reviews.Author: Stenar
Reviews.Content: The iPad Air is so much faster, thinner lighter than my old iPad.  I love every minute I am using it.
Reviews.Title: It's fast.

Reviews.Author: Jacob Weltchek "NOTWS"
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Battery life (10+ hours)- Thin, and light (about a pound)- Best app storeCons:- Expensive- Proprietary port- Fingerprint magnetSummary:If you want the Cadillac of tablets, then look no further!
Reviews.Title: Entertainment Paradise

Reviews.Author: Pamela Paulhamus
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my iPad Air!  I spent months doing product comparisons.  I spoke to many tech geeks at various stores in addition to reading hundreds of on-line reviews.  The one thing I wanted to know was if I could load photos from my camera's SD card into the iPad.  Everyone said no!  Even the people in the stores SELLING them!  They were wrong!  Apple has two items that allow for this.  I purchased the Lightning to SD Card Reader ($27) and it works beautifully.  I took the iPad with me on two recent trips.  It was great being able to transfer my photos daily into the iPad to view them as opposed to trying to look at them on my camera!  With the 128GB of storage, I can keep quite a few photos stored on the iPad.  There are many apps available for photo editing and sharing.  I love everything about the iPad!  It was also nice having it on the long flights....between looking at my photos and playing all the games I have loaded into it, the time just flew by!  Of course, there are many other reasons to love the iPad, but for me, being able to view and edit photos while away from home is priceless.  I wouldn't want to ever fly with my laptop because of the weight.  But the iPad Air...it's a real gem!  Weight-wise...it weighs less than most books I might have taken with me to read!  I highly recommend it!
Reviews.Title: I did a lot of research prior to buying!

Reviews.Author: Paige Clark
Reviews.Content: I love my iPad! Long battery life, great screen quality, light & portable. You can hook it up to your phone through iCloud and share apps, photos and contacts. You can text (iMessage) anyone in with an apple device from your iPad too! It's great. I use it daily with little to no problems
Reviews.Title: LOVE it

Reviews.Author: JoanB
Reviews.Content: The learning curve is steep for a previous non-Apple owner but well worth it.Overall I can't think of anything negative to say about the iPad Air.
Reviews.Title: This is my first Apple product

Reviews.Author: Pat Hackler
Reviews.Content: I love my new iPad Air. It is fantastic! It can do all the things my old laptop could do and more.
Reviews.Title: iPad Air

Reviews.Author: K. Bushaw
Reviews.Content: I gave one of these to my wife in exchange for her iPad 2 that she also loved very much.So, I got the hand me down which is still in very good condition.The most noticeable improvements over the iPad 2 are the speed and cameras and, of course, it is significantly thinner and lighter.About the only significant downer to this device is common to ALL iOS devices...and that is that you cannot access FLASH-based web sites or information.  Steve Jobs adamantly refused to support it to his dying day and that 'legacy' continues.So, back to the PC when we need to do that.I was concerned about going to the lightning connector but it hasn't been too much of a problem.  She just can't use it with some of our devices that have the original 30-pin docking stations.It's really nice that, currently, T-Mobile will give you 200MB of cellular data per month FREE with this model whether or not you bought it from them or have any of their other wireless services.  I just subscribed this one for my wife a couple days ago.
Reviews.Title: My wife loves it!

Reviews.Author: James R. Valley "vermont lover"
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my wife and she loves it a lot better than her old series 1 ipad can do so much more on it.
Reviews.Title: Ipad Air

Reviews.Author: Bonnie Dreyer
Reviews.Content: I have an Iphone but wanted something bigger so I could read books and newspapers and just have a bigger screen.  It is perfect for me and I am glad I got it.
Reviews.Title: Glad I Got It!

Reviews.Author: Jade
Reviews.Content: This item meets the expectations and is quite beautiful/ The pixels makes each image sharper and more clear. The effect of the camera is like nothing I have seen! I would recommend this product and would purchase it again!!!!!!
Reviews.Title: iPad Air!!

Reviews.Author: Ginger
Reviews.Content: The iPad Air is as great and better than it looks on the Apple website or commercials.  I had the mini and traded up for the Air.  I made a great decision and no one can come close to competing with Apple.  (Just my opinion).  I love my MAC, iPhone and iPad Air.
Reviews.Title: Love it!

Reviews.Author: Sohaib Aleem
Reviews.Content: for no obvious reason (no spills no voltage issues with other electronic appliances) stopped working. Headache not worth the investment and brand recognition
Reviews.Title: stopped working within 2 months of buying

Reviews.Author: Greg Brown
Reviews.Content: Nice device, but very fragile. I've had mine for about 6 months and the screen cracked for no apparent reason. Apple won't fix it - they will only replace it for $300 (on top of the $700 I already spent on it). No thanks.
Reviews.Title: Fragile

Reviews.Author: David Werble "davidwerble"
Reviews.Content: Even with the case it is light. More importantly it is FAST. I didn't really need the AT&T; hook up (haven;t bought it yet) so unless you are a traveler finding no WiFi I'd go with WiFI only and save some $$$$.
Reviews.Title: Waited for 5 gens for this gem

Reviews.Author: A. Kim
Reviews.Content: I have recently transitioned from PC/Android so I am still learning the rope but my overall experience have been very good.  Initial set up was breeze, Retina screen is pleasure to see, lighter weight means less stress on my wrist from extended use.However there was one issue where I thought people who are thinking of switching from Android tablet to iPad should consider carefully first.iPad has no file system like Android tablet so simple cut and paste file/folder transfer will not work.  Google it first with "How do you transfer multiple folders to iPad?" and read what others have said.  You can download third party software that will allow you transfer individual folder content at a time but that is tedious and time consuming if you one to transfer whole bunch of folders at once.If you can swallow the price and the above mentioned "issue", then I whole heartedly recommend iPad over Android tablet.
Reviews.Title: Good entertainment tablet

Reviews.Author: Mumbly Joe "MumblyJoe"
Reviews.Content: A lot of people have already talked about the merits of this device and the pros and cons. For me the decision wasn't so much which to buy but rather which one I wanted. Originally I got the mini to replace my kindle touch because of the price and the pocketable size. Ultimately I ended up with the air. Here's why:Grip: despite the very comfortable dimensions for 1 handed holding of the mini the extra thin bezel proved problematic. The palm rejection tech is supposed to be quite good but I found it unreliable and for those times I wanted to gets.  Eventually I always wanted to get a hold of it with  the bezel between my thumb and forefinger but either ended up with a thumb right in the middle of whatever I was watching or a hand cramp.Real estate: getting smaller means text is smaller especially on we pages In portrait mode. You can set the text size up for dynamic type but it doesn't work everywhere and when if does work and you change to landscape, then the text is far too big for the screen. Furthermore, in games where part of the screen is used for the controls I ended up wishing for a larger screen.Keyboard: the keyboard ended up being the main reason I went for the Air. While it is surprisingly good on the mini (really it blew me away how good the keyboard was in the mini) typing at that size for any extended period is taxing and it just can't compete with the Air if you plan on writing any amount. Furthermore, using the GarageBand keyboards are fairly awkward on the smaller screen. Unlike the accessory keyboards for the full size iPads, I found the external keyboards for the mini were actually much much worse than the onscreen keyboard.Pocketability: the mini fit quite nicely into a jacket pocket, in the climate where I live jackets are only really feasible about 3 or 4 months out of the year. Other than that it needs bag of some sort, which is really the same situation I'd be in with an Air.Weight: this made the choice the hardest. Holding the iPad mini feels like hardly anything at all. The iPad air feels considerably heavier. That affects everything you do with the tablet and the entire interaction with it. Fortunately it's mostly a matter of perspective. Put down the mini for a day and all of a sudden the air seems  quite light.For me the decision was made for the larger version but what about options?Cellular of no cellular? The free 3G on my kindle touch has gotten me out of a scrape more than once and having access to a no-strings-attached internet connection is guaranteed to come in handy at least once during the lifetime of your tablet. $130 is a lot to spend though, especially if you have a smart phone and free tethering on your plan. Originally I went for the wifi version for precisely this reason. However, the ability to tether is dependent on the carrier you happen to be using. Should you switch phones, carriers or plans or simply lose the phone while traveling tethering May no longer be a option and it's never going to be as convenient as simply opening the settings on your iPad and activating a plan. In addition you also gain the ability to use gps with a cellular modem and gain the benefits of enhanced find my iPhone accuracy in the event that it's stolen and the thieves know enough to keep it off wifi. Finally though, the possibility of a free 200 mb per month with t-mobile and the ability to switch carriers at will ended up pushing me to get the cellular version.So, after having initially been interested by the mini, a lot  of research, even more indecision and having bought, lived with and sold multiple versions of this thing I can safely say that the iPad Air with cellular is the  version I'd pick. If you don't plan on typing a lot with it though or watching movies, go for the mini.
Reviews.Title: Air or mini, cellular or wifi? The hardest choice.

Reviews.Author: JoHarley
Reviews.Content: The has become a great tool for my photography needs. I got it around mid November so I haven’t had it that long. I've been tired of carrying a laptop when going on a trip which I used to download daily the photos taken that day. Thought I’d give the iPad a try.Pros:- It’s super light in weight which makes it ideal for carrying.- It’s fast. Apps run very nicely.- Great camera and photo tools.- Beautiful screen! Photos look super nice on display.Cons:- BIG, BIG CON! You can’t connect an external, off the shelf, drive to it for backing up my photos. Ended up spending twice the money for the Seagate Wireless Plus, 1 TB. It took a bit of setting up but it does do the job. BUT STILL! Why on earth can’t I simply connect a $70 one TB drive to the unit?? Seems a bit petty to me.- Connectors costs a bundle! I needed an SD card reader, an HDMI connector for streaming video to TVs in hotels, and a Micro SD connector  for my smart phone and other devices. The HDMI connector itself was $50.00. This thing probably cost $0.50 to make, but I WAS warned  about Apple’s marketing tactics…- The manual leaves a bit to be desired. I’ve learned more from friends then I have from their manual. Ended up with the book “My iPad” for Que. Good book…Still got some learning to do with this device but it has been fun to figure out. And for photography work, it’s going to be nice to have.
Reviews.Title: First Ever Apple Product - First Ever iPad - LOVE IT

Reviews.Author: Philly Music
Reviews.Content: As a MacBook Pro user and Apple supporter, I'm surprised and very disappointed that Safari on my brand-new iPad Air 16G crashes constantly.  It's obviously a known issue, as the discussion boards are filled with similar reports.  This could not have been missed during product testing. Inexcusable.
Reviews.Title: Safari Crashes Constantly

Reviews.Author: James Patterson "Helen"
Reviews.Content: Brought this for my husband and he can't put it down - he loves his iPad !!!!! He had the previous iPad but loves this one so much better!
Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Author: Alexey
Reviews.Content: I don't really wanna to explain why I've chosen this item. Just like it. Very strange from my point of view to force to complete reviews...
Reviews.Title: like it

Reviews.Author: Hugo
Reviews.Content: It is what Apple claims that it is. Superb in all aspects. Quicker connection to wifi networks, easy to use even for those who are used to android.  In fact is much easier for first timers than android.  Management of memory is also exceptional and video quality is amazing too.I would recommend very much this item.Seller accomplished everything he promised, very good one.
Reviews.Title: Excellent product

Reviews.Author: brian mooty
Reviews.Content: I love the I pad air it's everything that I expected it to be and more and my wife has took it over lol.
Reviews.Title: My I pad

Reviews.Author: Jim Taylor
Reviews.Content: My brother had his old iPad stolen while in hospital for a serious operation.  All local stores were sold out. Amazon came through!
Reviews.Title: Excellent Xmas present delivered on time!

Reviews.Author: J. Solorzano "drummer"
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I like apple products very much.  As soon as she learned about the iPad Air she wanted one, and she is very happy with it.
Reviews.Title: Great product.

Reviews.Author: Padmini Kadaba
Reviews.Content: The girls simply loved this gift. They liked the latest version and how fast, light and efficient the product really is.
Reviews.Title: This was a Christmas present.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer Martinez
Reviews.Content: Have used an Ipad 2 and this is so much nicer.  Better resolution, good screen size, but still nice and compact.
Reviews.Title: It is a great product!

Reviews.Author: LGH135
Reviews.Content: I love it - wasn't sure how i'd feel about this new version but it's perfect.  Much better than previous versions.
Reviews.Title: Great

Reviews.Author: Frances Tungate
Reviews.Content: I gave away a full size laptop, and got the Ipad Air.  I love it...It's easy to hold, and I can surf the web, play games, check e-mail, and write documents, and take pictures anywhere. I rarely used my laptop, but I use the iPad Air every day. I highly recommend this product.
Reviews.Title: Apple iPad Air

Reviews.Author: yo
Reviews.Content: My husband loves it.  I have an IPAD 2 and I am jealouse of him!!!  It is a great gift and worth the money but of course if they ever became cheaper I would buy another!
Reviews.Title: AWESOME

Reviews.Author: Michiko W.W. Campbell
Reviews.Content: never  had a doubt. This product is complete what i expected and i am glad i purchased. The color and size of the product is very durable as well. its fast and easy to work with best product ever
Reviews.Title: wonderful

Reviews.Author: cheryl miller
Reviews.Content: I'm on this daily! Love love love it!! So happy with this purchase!  I'm so glad I choose my iPad over all the other choices!
Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!!

Reviews.Author: Dean G.
Reviews.Content: My first IPad and it's the air I love itLook forward to get iPhone 5sSoon happy new year
Reviews.Title: Cool

Reviews.Author: Robert A Griner JR
Reviews.Content: What more can you say about an Ipad.  It is my wife's Christmas present.  She loves it.  She works at a large University and has long been involved with Apple.  This is her first personal tablet and she loves it.  It has met all of her expectations.
Reviews.Title: It's and Ipad!

Reviews.Author: Dolores P.
Reviews.Content: I bought the iPad Air having never had a tablet previously. I had just recently bought the iPhone 5c and decided to try the all-Apple experience. So glad I did. The iPad is crazy easy to use, has a great screen, and syncs all my photos and apps seamlessly with the phone. I am no a technical guru, so I appreciate something that is simple to use and easy to transport.
Reviews.Title: If you want easy, this is it!

Reviews.Author: ParkerD
Reviews.Content: I love my new iPad air 16gb... I am going to get a higher gig later so this doesn't matter too much to me now that i got used to it. My iPad , when showing a black screen, has light leaks. I am very bothered by small things like this. I am not returning it because I love it but I did have light leaks on my iPad air :(
Reviews.Title: Great BUT...

Reviews.Author: vp
Reviews.Content: I bought the original iPad on day one and can't imagine life without my pad.  I use it for work, for play and everything in between.  The form factor on this iPad is excellent and I wasn't expecting it to make such a difference - it DOES.  I love the feel of the mini, but I need my big screen (video editing for example).  This is the perfect size - it's really a 'bigger' mini, if that makes sense.  I can't say enough great things about it.  LOVE!!!!!!!
Reviews.Title: I upgraded from the iPad 3 and LOVE the Air!!!

Reviews.Author: Mitchell Castillo
Reviews.Content: Wow, it was just how i expected! definitely it's the best iPad!!!!! (tablet), the weight it's super! the design just marvellous. One of the best product that I ever had.
Reviews.Title: Just Impresive!!

Reviews.Author: Israel Besser
Reviews.Content: Love it, was delivered on time and it met all expectations and more, am thrilled. Would recommend it to anyone I liked
Reviews.Title: Great product and service

Reviews.Author: redrover
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 11182013:A number of comments seem to take issue with my statement of "not feeling like glass" but that is JUST MY PERSONAL FEELING. Others about the brightness...indeed I do have it cranked all the way up but the brightness is nowhere as bright as what is found on the Samsung Note 10.1 2014 edition, nor the iPad4 and my most recent purchase the Samsung Note 8. All 3 when cranked all the way up are much brighter than the iPad Air.I will be buying the new Google nexus 7(even with all the GPS and multi-touch issues) for the upcoming holidays but even in the store, that too seems much brighter...I am very dismayed at this lack of brightness from the Air but it is still more than adequate for indoors. I have not tried it outdoors nor will I as this is not my "outdoor" tablet...lol.I like Apple and the tight integration of their apps and the reason many including myself continue to buy their products. I do feel the price for this latest iteration is them trying to make money at our expense. WHO HERE DOES NOT KNOW IN THEIR HEART THAT APPLE IS TRYING TO GET IN ON THE CHRISTMAS RUSH AND PUT THE AIR AND THE NEW MINI WITHOUT THE FINGERPRINT FEATURES FOUND ON THE NEW IPHONE...COME MARCH MAYBE APRIL, APPLE WILL UPDATE THE IPAD AIR TO INCLUDE THAT FEATURE.I will continue to buy Apple mostly because their store has apps that are better, with more choices and work extremely well with their devices. I think this product is a 3 1/2 Stars at best and mostly for the size and weight reduction that is very significant. I feel the "glass" is too thin but seems to be durable as I have really been typing a lot on it as well as playing several games that require a lot of tapping. I am very happy with the size reduction but feel the brightness is not up to par with other new tablets or the iPad4.Recently the Safari browser has been "crashing" a lot over the past week in that when you tap on a hyperlink, the browser will basically disappear off the screen. None of the tabs close but it just disappears and returns you to the home screens. I also am finding the browser will get stuck/freeze for several minutes before resuming. I have several calls in with apple support and they are looking into the issues.Other issues is the VIDEO app, if you play a video via streaming not downloading and leave it somewhere like the middle or so on, it actually reduces your available memory by the amount you have watched from what I can glean. IT IS LIKE DOWNLOADING THE MOVIE TO THE POINT YOU HAVE WATCHED IT TO EVEN THOUGH YOU SELECTED THE STREAMING LINK. If you do this with several movies, you can basically wipe out your free memory. I find it difficult to clear the buffer and have basically learned to tell the app not to display any movies then to display movies then play the movie but move the slider to the beginning and press stop playing then done. Of these many steps I eventually clear the buffer but I am not sure which of all these steps actually is what does it if any!Oh lastly, the WI-fi is fantastic.FINAL RATING IS 3 1/2 STARS...MAYBE 4 IF NOT FOR THE BRIGHTNESS ISSUE.First I own iPad 2 and 4 and Samsung Note 10.1 2014 edition.I like...not love...the new iPad Air as it is faster both in operating the software apps and graphic intensive apps. The apps continue to be fantastic for all the pads not just the Air.Apple did a great job on the weight but FEEL STRONGLY THAT THE NEW SCREEN IS NOT NEARLY AS BRIGHT AS MY iPad 4 NOR DOES IT EVEN FEEL LIKE GLASS.As I type this review on the Air, the "cheap tapping" feel of this glass leaves me wondering how durable this glass is. It feels thin and makes a tapping sound not found on the more solid glass on my other two iPads.Oh I am keeping the Air for the faster processors but feel Apple has put out a product whose screen will not be as durable as prior pads.I can see it flex when I push down on it with minimal effort and have some light distortion when I press down like old type LED TVS.Apple over prices their products because they can and really did so on this iteration of their iPad. In my estimation the glass feels like plastic and the brightness is much diminished when compared to my iPad 4 and so must have a higher profit margin with all these cost cutting that resulted in a new iPad that for all practically purposes is just faster but not as solidly built as prior pads.Time will tell on the screen and maybe this is the way all tablets are headed to achieve the weight reduction and thinness. I love the ability to hold the Air in one hand comfortably for much longer than any of my current tablets. I am OK to sacrifice the glass quality as long as the touch screen does not suffer or long term screen reliability.I wish Apple would splurge and include a 6 foot charging cord...OMG $600 for 32GB and the cord is so short still after all this time...lol.
Reviews.Title: light, fast and easy to hold but...

Reviews.Author: Zhiyi Li
Reviews.Content: I got the item 8 days later after I ordered it, fair enough. However, it was describing as a new item but the box already being opened. Also the original screen protector is missing, which means somebody must used it somehow. But the most awful part of this IPAD is somebody set up a freaking code for lock of screen.
Reviews.Title: Please describe the item clear

Reviews.Author: Windsail
Reviews.Content: I am a longtime MAC user and fan, but this expensive toy is a great disappointment. I was led to believe that document file transfers would be easy between my MacBook Pro and the iPad. Wrong. Wrong. Wrong. The two machines cannot be directly connected. To send a doc you have to do it via an e-mail attachment or iCloud. Use e-mail and formatting is lost unless you use  iWork, and that does not have many of the capabilities of Microsoft Word. You even loses page numbers when transferring Microsoft Office docs--a pretty basic function. The ironny is that MSOffice is designed for MAC! There are third party workarounds that are very cumbersome. So much for MACs elegant design brags.  The alternative is the Cloud which also only syncs docs made in iWork. As for photo transfers, unless you have the same bandwidth as NASA, forget it. Apple--wouldn't it just be simpler to create a USB connection? Not too much to ask for in an excessively expensive machine. If you want a lightweight machine to play a few games or read a newspaper this is the machine for you. For a professional writer, forget it. Apple--you've just lost a longtime fan--and I mean longtime…
Reviews.Title: Great toy/lousy writer-researcher tool

Reviews.Author: Carlos Ghersi De la Cruz Taquire
Reviews.Content: Just came with charger that's all . No manual , don't have any needle for open the sim case. But work well
Reviews.Title: Good

Reviews.Author: Ali Al-Siraih
Reviews.Content: I's just an Excellent Tablet and with a unique design.. and really like AirI recommend buying from this seller.
Reviews.Title: Just Excellent Tablet

Reviews.Author: Wayne Goeas
Reviews.Content: My wife loves it! Very light in comparison to the older generation and processor is very fast. Nice to have the extra storage (64 GB). Delivery was as stated....speedy delivery!
Reviews.Title: Apple iPad Air

Reviews.Author: Barbara Sahrhage
Reviews.Content: I love my new I Pad Air it works great! Also it arrived in excellent shape. the only thing I tried to charge it and found it had a European plug, so I had to call The Apple Store and than drove to the nearest store which was about 55 miles from my home. They gave me a new plug that fit and I have not had any other problems.
Reviews.Title: IPad Air

Reviews.Author: Abhijit Mishra
Reviews.Content: I ordered the iPad air from these guys expecting to receive the brand new factory sealed piece.Not an old, piece which has already had it's 90 day telephonic warranty expired.As it went for a gift, I can't just ask it back and return it to Amazon. I feel so embarrassed and cheated.
Reviews.Title: I feel Cheated

Reviews.Author: Theodore Harris
Reviews.Content: Dropped it 2 feet. Landed on the SIDE and it made a crack. NOT A HAIR LINE CRACK but a HUGE Crack on the screen. There is ZERO DURABILITY in this tablet. I also found out its HOLLOW in the areas where the camera is... Apple you suck!
Reviews.Title: Breaks VERY EASILY. NOT EVEN A LITTLE DURABLE

Reviews.Author: jacksonw765
Reviews.Content: Great apple devise, I used it to write this review! Highly recommended. Very light and very powerful, but you want to get more than 16gb.
Reviews.Title: Great iPad

Reviews.Author: Alan Dale Daniel
Reviews.Content: My thoughts on the latest ipad Air from Apple.  First, try to buy the product through Amazon.  If you get lucky you will avoid 38+ dollars in taxes.  In my state I get charged that anyway.  I bought mine a few weeks ago and I now regret my decision.The ipad Air, full size not the mini, is expensive for what you get.  The much talked about retina display really isn’t much better than Apple’s or Samsung’s normal display.  I take a lot of photos and even at full zoom I can’t make out much difference.  The Apple ipad Air does NOT come with an SD card slot, and if you want to upgrade from 16gb to 32gb you will be looking at over $100 additional dollars.  Many of Apple’s competitors have the SD slot and cost less.Apple sells an SD card “reader.”  You can download from the card to the ipad but NOT the other way.  And the ipad SD card reader will run you $30 plus dollars.  You must buy other $30+ dollar accessories if you want to use a USB memory stick for example.  I purchased a non- Apple SD card triple reader (USB and SD for example) for about $9 dollars.  The machine complains at me but it still works (but, once again, it only loads to the machine not from the ipad as a normal SD slot does).An SD card reader would have been easy to install as part of the iPad, and this gives their competitors an edge, especially when one is taking photographs and trying to download them immediately to examine on something other than a 2 inch screen.  As I shoot RAW (large files) photos with my Canon this inability to use an SD card is a real pain.Downloading music from Amazon to iTunes isn’t any picnic either.  My wife has an android device from Dell running Jellybean and she downloads everything with zero problems.  Plus, she has an SD card slot which really helps.  Her screen is as sharp as mine.Finally, the OS systems.  Jellybean has about a million apps written for it while I have about 200 - or that is how it seems to me.  Her system is faster than mine AND her system is intuitive and mine is not.  I’ve had to read over the Apple manual for ipad three times trying to get things done.  Maybe my largest gripe is I bought the Apple thinking several Apple machines could sync up and trade information easily including photographs and music and documents.  Wrong.  I’ve tried numerous syncing ideas and none of them work.  I started using Pages (an Apple word processing program) instead to Word to get it to transfer.  Finally, I saved it to the cloud and managed to get the document to the other machine.  Photographs that are in the photo stream do transfer; however, getting the photograph into the stream when it was not automatically placed there by the ipad doesn’t work.  And finding photos to look at in the ipad, when the ipad did not take the photo and the photo is on another machine (with the photo stream on and home sharing on) the photo still does not come up.  Very frustrating.After using the ipad and watching and using Jellybean and Android in action I think the Android devices are a much better deal.  Get one with an SD card slot.  I am certain Apple has designed their machine so the user cannot get extra storage on the machine (as an SD slot would allow) and must buy a more expensive machine if they handle large files.  If you like buying music at Amazon good luck getting it to iTunes onto your machine if it is an Apple (Yes, I have Amazon cloud player).  My wife got her music downloaded in about a minute.  It took me an hour to get one of Mozart’s songs I had purchased downloaded to my computer.In retrospect, since the programs do NOT sync up as advertised, the machine has little storage unless you pay an enormous additional price, the retina display is not revolutionary, and the number of programs are minimal compared to Android I wish I had purchased an Android.  Samsung seems to be on the cutting edge there, although my wife’s Dell is performing just fine.
Reviews.Title: Poor Product

Reviews.Author: Oscar Crumby
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this product to anyone that is looking for a tablet.  I have found it has met all my expectations.  The only problem I had with it is the necessity for a keyboard.
Reviews.Title: Apple iPad Air

Reviews.Author: YU Chen Yueh
Reviews.Content: Good and quickly but the package in the left up cone has little crease. Hope next time to protect more good.
Reviews.Title: Quickly

Reviews.Author: Artem Lobovskiy
Reviews.Content: This is a good tablet PC, display is the best! But iOS 7 make it not so fast as I expected.
Reviews.Title: Good

Reviews.Author: Brenda Williamson
Reviews.Content: Bought as gift for my husband.  He likes it so far, said little heavier than he thought it would be. Still too new to really rate how it preforms for the long term.
Reviews.Title: Enjoy iPad Air so far

Reviews.Author: hrhomer "hrhomer"
Reviews.Content: I ordered an iPad Air, and got exactly what I wanted. An iPad Air. It works very well. eighteen nineteen twenty.
Reviews.Title: This is an iPad review

Reviews.Author: jay endiape
Reviews.Content: did'nt figure it out that this will be smaller than my previous Ipad2 and almost no difference for having a retina featrure. if there's an available Ipad2 i'm defenitely getting one again.
Reviews.Title: unexpected.

Reviews.Author: Anthony Berno
Reviews.Content: This has been a bit of a disappointment. I purchased the iPad Air with T-Mobile service directly from Apple, and when I try to set up my account, it informs me that "my zip code is not valid". (It's 95482, which is Ukiah, California, and from the connection indicator on the screen, we do seem to have 4G service here.) I spent 45 minutes on the phone with T-Mobile support to try to resolve this and was informed that I had to spend $10 on a new SIM card, which I did. On receiving the new card, the problem was not resolved. I called support again, and was shuttled from one line to another and finally disconnected. Nobody seemed to know what was going on or how to help me.This is really annoying. I'm a professional software engineer and have a lot of experience with mobile devices, and have never had to deal with this kind of runaround before.Add to that the fact that Safari crashes about once per hour, and I have to say this device is a big, expensive dud. Thin and light, yes, but in every way inferior to the iPad 3 I have already. Overall, a regrettable purchase.
Reviews.Title: Getting T-Mobile service activated is apparently IMPOSSIBLE

Reviews.Author: James P Solan
Reviews.Content: I recieved this product and it was missing the AT&T; SIM card I dont understand how you can not have the card in type of Apple product. Who is QA this when it leaves Apple?
Reviews.Title: NO SIM CARD

Reviews.Author: Luz Montoya
Reviews.Content: I asked for an ipad air black with space gray. When we open the box: SURPRISE!!  They send me a white one! I didn't spent $10 dollars for this... They have to send what I asked for...
Reviews.Title: Apple Ipad air

Reviews.Author: Adriana Martinez Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Really disapointed with only wifi model... I gonna sell it to buy a 3G model. The size is not a big difference between old models
Reviews.Title: Don't worth the money I pay for it

Reviews.Author: Cooks Saw Manufacturing LLC
Reviews.Content: I WAITED FOR 4 WEEKS AND THEN , I HAD TO PURCHASE FROM ANOTHER SOURCE.  I was not happy with the way this order was handled.
Reviews.Title: I DID NOT RECEIVE THE IPAD  FROM THIS ORDER

Reviews.Author: skcrowe
Reviews.Content: I was unable to connect to cellular data after adding the iPad air to my plan.  When I called tmobile to find out why, they checked the iPad's IMEI number and told me that it was blocked due to fraud and I should send it back and get a refund as soon as possible!  I contacted amazon.com's fraud department when I hung up the phone!  I am not happy at all!
Reviews.Title: Product was stolen/fraudulent per tmobile

Reviews.Author: Bubba
Reviews.Content: Don't believe all the reviews out there saying the ipad Air is the better tablet. Those reviews are biased and only bring up the minor upgrades from the old ipad and base the comparisons off of those few things. And the only two really bad things they had to say about the ipad Air was that it didn't have a fingerprint scanner and it didn't come in gold. The 80's called and they want their gaudy flashy gold bling back.Most of these reviews will only focus on those points and will not mention all the other advantages the Surface 2 has. And for the few reviews that do mention the other features the Surface 2 has, they still favor the ipad because the camera was nicer or more apps. Really?I will use the Surface 2 as comparison because it will show how ridiculous the bias is regardless of capabilities.What the reviews usually leave out or down play.Surface 21. Full office software. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote.2. Wide screen optimized for wide screen movies. When held in portrait when you are surfing the web for example, you get a a longer list so you don't scroll as much.3. Sd slot. Easy to download or upload data on the fly.4. 3.0 USB so you can easily backup files to a hard drive and not have all your eggs in one basket. Or transfer files with anything that has a USB plug and also charge your phone. Ipad? No, unless you have the adapter and you can't charge your phone.5. Can print to almost every printer.6. Hdmi port7. Flash support so you are not limited browsing the web.8. Built in two position kickstand.9. Thin keyboards that double as covers. Can get them background lit, flat, with real keys, and a new one coming out with built in battery to recharge your Surface at the same time on a charge. Battery in tablet is good already though. Some say that you need to buy a keyboard to make full use of the Surface and adds to the cost. Ridiculous. You do not. It will make life more easier though if you are working on a spreadsheet or word document. With an ipad you don't need one because what use would it be for? Sure there are apps. but they are limited to what you can create or edit. You have to do major creating and editing on a computer first and then hook up the ipad and transfer it.10. Hook up to your t.v. or another monitor and drag an open window to the second screen.11. Do a split screen on the tablet.12. Run multiple tasks at the same time in the background like listening to music, watching a video and doing something else like typing an email or working on an a office document in split screen mode.13. Wirelessly sync with your xbox and play games on your t.v, stream videos, pictures, etc.14. Drag and drop files.15. Can set up individual separate accounts on the tablet and have parental monitoring updates and deciding what child can do on the tablet.Now these are not all the Surface 2 offers. I am finding new things still.The ipad Air is basically the same ipad as before with minor tweaks. It's faster and lighter. Still does the same thing as before, nothing new.ipad Air1. Powerful processor. For doing nothing new. Future fingerprint scanner? Tablet will still only run apps. as before.2. Lighter and thinner is negated by the cases to protect the ipad and without a keyboard.3. Upgraded camera. Put it down, your annoying the people behind your trying to see the wedding or play. Use a real camera.4. No USB or sd slot. Need adapters for just about everything. And with the Surface 2 you can plug the unit in when it is dead and keep on using it and still do things via the sd card or usb cables. On an ipad you can't do both. You either charge it or plug in an adapter to the only port the ipad has do to something. And if it is dead, you have to wait until you charge it first. Also you need to bring all the adapters and keyboard with you vs the Surface 2 of which all you need is the power cable. And the cover/keyboard is so thin it is negligible in bulk and weight. And justifying that the ipad has third party keyboards is not valid. It is a separate bulky keyboard and the ipad does not support mouse functions. You are stuck with third party hardware that is Apple specific whereas with the Surface you can use anything that supports micro SD or USB. And having to buy all these accessories tofor the ipad.will not be cheap. People gripe about the Suface cover/keyboard costs too much. Well to buy a seperate cover for an ipad will cost $40.00 and it will flop around and a non intergrated keypad will cost $100.00 that you have to carry seperatley.5. Having to convert simple files with Apple software a hassle.5. Tons of apps. Android not far behind. And Microsoft growing. How much apps. does one need?6. What good is the Reina display if it isn't widescreen? Picture is actually smaller than 9.7 with the black bars.7. Only compatible with Apple products i.e. cant print unless it is an AirPrint printer or stream to t.v. unless Apple t.v.8. Slightly upgraded camera. Put it away! Your blocking my view! And people with a 4.8 inch phone look ridiculous? At least they are not carrying around the perfect sized iphone for one handed operation along with a 9.6 tablet that takes two hands. Kind of contradicting.The ipad Air has more negatives than positives, so how can it be better? Android tablets have more features even than the ipads. I guess if you want one just for games and apps, then an ipad or a higher end Android tablet might suit your needs. People are not weighing in that the Surface 2 can do more than just play games.Now back to the Surface 2. There was a slight learning curve to understand what all the gestures do. It didn't take long though. Look it up on youtube and you will pick it up real quick along with a lot of tips and tricks of what it is capable of. There different ways to open, close, move, split screen, multitask, etc.The tablet feels a little heavy in the hand if you had to hold it I admit. But the two position kickstand works pretty good on the lap as I didn't think it would. I don't have to have a cover to add to the bulk to double as a kickstand also. And even if I put on one of the super thin keyboards they would add very little weight or bulk and they snap on and off without any hassle.The boot up time takes a little while when completely off, but remember it is opening real office programs. When in sleep mode it opens up quickly.I went several days at a time of casual use and in sleep mode without charging and it still had a charge.The tiles are nice because it is real time data so I can glance at them without opening up an app. for email, weather, etc. On Apple you have a bunch of icons and you have open it up, Android you can use widgets.With a real browser and Flash I can use full websites rather than a mobile version. And also it is a lot easier to open multiple tabs when surfing the internet unlike some tablets where it is a pain to pop back and forth between tabs.As I mentioned above it is nice to have the split screen because my kids can research on the web on one side and write their paper on the other side while listening to music of which they shouldn't be.The only two cons I find on the Surface 2 so far is that the power cord is only about 58 inches long. You have to be really close to an outlet of some sort.And the main con was that the software and backup takes up about 16 gigs so you don't have the full gigs of memory stated. So might have to get an sd card. Yes other tablets you only lose about 2 gigs, but remember they are pretty much entertainment tablets only and can't do what the Surface 2 can do.If you are waiting for a ipad Air Pro to come out. Don't be surprised if it doesn't come with a Retina display, finger print scanner, nice camera, etc. You will have to wait for the Pro S, Pro S1, etc. to get one feature at a time and not several at once. I mean come on, cant even throw in a simple camera flash. The ipads shouldn't even be placed in the categories of tablets that can run Office software. There should be a category for Dumb Tablets that only run apps, a category for Smart Tablets for those that can run fully functioning office software and not just limited mobile versions, and Extreme Tablets for ones that can run full blown Office suites.If your a die hard Apple fan, please back up your arguments with something valid other than ipad rocks or a childish angry comment. Because if you do, it will prove my point.
Reviews.Title: So revolutionary they can't even throw in a camera flash.

Reviews.Author: G. Johnson "big hands"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the cellular to use with Square credit card sales. First of all, it took over six hours just to set up the iPad Air, because it wouldn't receive the information that was being inputed. Very frustrating. After three calls to Apple tech support, we finally got the set up finished and were able to use the unit. Next, we were told that the SIM card from our cellular data provider would work with the iPad Air. It did not. So, my only option was to pay AT&T; or any of the other three providers $50 per month for cellular. That's a rip off. It's no coincidence that all four of the cellular providers available for the iPad Air charge virtually the same high price for coverage. So, the IPad Air is very pricey for a tablet, it's very time consuming to set up, the cellular coverage is very expensive. So, we returned it and got our money back. That was the best decision I made in regards to the Apple iPad Air.
Reviews.Title: Don't Waste Your Money!!!

Reviews.Author: Don from VA
Reviews.Content: I got this as a Christmas gift for my wife.  When she opened it and looked at the description she noticed it was a 16G model.  We need at least a 32G model.  I sent it back and will be looking for the 32G model to purchase.  I will review it later.  I rated this model 3-stars simply based on their past history with other iPads (we have an earlier version and we are extremely pleased with it).  If the iPad Air is anything like their other iPads it will be a hit with us and it get a higher rating than 3-stars.
Reviews.Title: Ordered the wrong one

Reviews.Author: Philip Walter Bonsell
Reviews.Content: Hello.I just got one of these tablets from Apple. I assumed I'd like their products as I had a high opinion of them as a company. Most of these reviews are full of how great they are and tech data. I'm 52, I'm not dumb, I can work a PC, I've got a BMW, a Bang and Olufsen system, a couple of homes and the rest.Well it's an education; we're all used to be expected to work stuff right out of the box, but if you're an apple novice, if you don't have a smart 'phone (I know that's putting me in a minority but why would I need one when I've been out the workplace for ten years?), if you still use CD's for music and DVD's / blu ray for films, well take my advice and don't bother. A nightmare to set up, impossible to put right if you get it wrong; mines back in the box three hours after delivery and there it will stay. I'll put up with windows instead.For all you guys who want to do loads of stuff, well good luck to you. I just wanted Amazon, Google search and my mail live on a screen next to my seat in the living room and was prepared to spend $500 to have that in a nice package. It didn't deliver, and no I don't want to have to go around to my local Apple store and ask some guy pursuing an alterative lifestyle how to do it. Much easier to make do with the $150 Acer notebook, even if it does need to be on a mains lead most of the time.Farewell Apple; if it had worked I'd have bought a pricey Mac, but that ship's sailed and I'm $2000 ahead.Phil
Reviews.Title: Don't assume you'll like an ipad

Reviews.Author: Sandra E. Pike
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the iPad 2 which was also a wonderful tablet.  The screen is outstanding.  I can hold it for long periods to use for reading as it truly is featherweight!
Reviews.Title: A joy to use!

Reviews.Author: Reader6000
Reviews.Content: This is the most over rated product on the market today. Nothing can be done without Itunes. They charge you at every turn. The picture is great but that is all it has going for it.
Reviews.Title: I hate it.

Reviews.Author: the truth
Reviews.Content: I just bought it to try it out.  No � customization.  No sd card slot, sub par camera.... Just overall...... Lacking!!!!
Reviews.Title: made for old people
